fields.description:
h3. Summary

query dsl provider plugin is not always being updated when Service Desk is updated
h3. Environment

Still trying to determine what environmental aspects might factor in here
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have an existing work Jira Service Desk (say a 3.7 or 3.8 version)
 # Upgrade Jira/Service Desk to a more recent version, such as 7.9.2/3.12.2 or 7.10.0/3.13.0

h3. Expected Results

Service Desk Queues should be functional after the upgrade
h3. Actual Results

Queues are not working.
 Logs show error messages like this:
{code:java}
2018-06-06 10:10:20,107 http-nio-1081-exec-10 ERROR <username> 610x154x1 192r6a6 (null),<user-ip>,127.0.0.1 /rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/<projectname>/queues [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: com.querydsl.sql.dml.SQLInsertClause.getBatchCount()I
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.querydsl.sql.dml.SQLInsertClause.getBatchCount()I
 at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.queue.QueueStore.addColumns(QueueStore.java:218)
 at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.queue.QueueStore.addQueue(QueueStore.java:111)
 at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.queue.QueueManagerImpl.lambda$null$4(QueueManagerImpl.java:80)
 at io.atlassian.fugue.Either$RightProjection.map(Either.java:872)
 at io.atlassian.fugue.Either.map(Either.java:217)
...
{code}

Other variants include: {code}"com.querydsl.sql.dml.SQLUpdateClause.getBatchCount () I"{code}

h3. Cause
The Query dsl provider plugin is not always installed in the correct needed version after the upgrade. 
ie. SD 3.13 needs the plugin version 4.1.4, but sometimes only 4.0.7 is available.

h3. Workaround
We can manually update this query dsl plugin to a newer version to fix this:
 # Download the querydsl 4.1.4 plugin jar file in this link: [querydsl-4.1.4-provider-plugin-1.0.jar !https://getsupport.atlassian.com/images/icons/link_attachment_7.gif|width=7,height=7!|https://drive.google.com/file/d/1gUyCHFojUcnrHPnzUPFP34Q3LlhPvPUx/view?usp=sharing]
 # Stop JIRA
 # Remove the querydsl jar file that is located in the directory $JIRA_HOME/plugins/installed-plugins/ (the file name should be similar to querydsl-4.0.7-provider-plugin-1.1)
 # Copy the downloaded file into this same /installed-plugins/ folder
 # Start JIRA

h3. Notes
This problem does not happen for all upgrades. Only some customers have found this plugin is not updating in their system.
fields.summary: Query DSL provider plugin is not always being updated when Service Desk is updated

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Special characters such as the Apostrophe sign ( ' ), double quote ( " ), lower sign (<), greater sign (>) are not encoded properly for suggested knowledge base articles on create form.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Space in a Confluence instance
# Create a new Page on that space containing apostrophe / single quote (') or double quote (") sign in title and / or description
# Create an application link between the JIRA instance and the Confluence instance
# Create a Service Desk project in JIRA
# Go to *Project Settings > Knowledge base* and select the space created in Confluence to be the KB space configured in Service Desk, per the instructions in [Set up a knowledge base for self-service|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver/set-up-a-knowledge-base-for-self-service-956713310.html]
# On Customer portal, open new request and fill the summary so it searches and shows KB article (eg. vpn)
# KB articles are searched and shown

h3. Expected Results

Apostrophe is encoded correctly.
h3. Actual Results

Apostrophe ( ' ) is not encoded correctly, it shows
{noformat}
'
{noformat}
instead of the sign itself. Character ( ` ) is shown correctly.

Also:
- the double quote ( " ) shows as:
{code}"{code}
- the lower sign shows as:
{code}<{code}
- the greater sign shows as
{code}>{code}

 !kb-search.jpeg|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

None
h3. Notes

- Encoding across all components for both products was set to UTF-8 and database collation for both products were supported.
- *Issue reproducible when using recent versions of Confluence such as 6.10.x or g.14.x, but not older versions such as 6.3.1*
fields.summary: Special characters not encoded properly for suggested knowledge base articles on create form

fields.description:
h3. Summary

[Get customer request by ID or key|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-servicedesk/REST/3.6.2/#servicedeskapi/request-getCustomerRequestByIdOrKey] returns a 404 when the request type is empty.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a request in project A for request type X
 # Move request to project B which doesn't have request type X
 # Do not select a new request type for the request
 # Fetch the request using the REST API

h3. Expected Results

Return a JSON response containing the existing values for the customer request
h3. Actual Results
{code}
{
  "errorMessage": "The request type you are trying to view does not exist.",
  "i18nErrorMessage": {
    "i18nKey": "sd.customerview.error.requestTypeNotFound",
    "parameters": []
  }
}
{code}
h3. Notes

Based on the documentation for [Get my customer requests|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-servicedesk/REST/3.6.2/#servicedeskapi/request-getMyCustomerRequests], 404 is returned when request type is not found. For [Get customer request by id or key|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-servicedesk/REST/3.6.2/#servicedeskapi/request-getCustomerRequestByIdOrKey], a 404 is returned when the customer request does not exist.

Customer request can be viewed by the customer via the portal view, hence, a more consistent experience is requested.
h3. Workaround:

Because the request type is empty, this is not a service desk "request." This is a JIRA issue in a JIRA Service Desk project. The "request" endpoint will not work because the issue is not a "request"
 * The issue may be retrieved using the [JIRA REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/rest-apis/]
 ** 
{noformat}
GET /rest/api/2/issue/{issueIdOrKey}{noformat}

 ** The user making the REST API request must be a user who is able to view the issue in the regular JIRA interface.

App developers may need to retrieve the issue as a customer who does not have access to regular JIRA interface. Fetch the issue using the [JAVA API |https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/java-apis/] instead of the REST API.
 * Note that "customerContextService" may be used to check permissions like [described here |https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/are-service-desk-apis-meant-to-disallow-portal-customer-users-from-accessing-them/18560/3]
fields.summary: Return request details even if request type is empty

fields.description:
h5. Problem definition
Today, we can read an Automation rule's log via the project settings > Automation > click on "View log" for the selected rule's log. The log includes all the execution flow of a particular rule in all tickets. 

However, there's no quick way to find out all the rules that have been executed per ticket. Admin is expected to identify the rule in question and check the execution result of the ticket for the given rule.

h5. Suggestion
To have an audit log for admins to check the list of Automation rules that have been executed successfully or with errors. It's like a reverse engineering of the current process.

h5. Why it is important
For a project with many Automation rules e.g. more than 10, having to identify the rule-in-action and filter by ticket is very time-consuming. It'd be really handy if there's an Audit log or any equivalent tool to show the rule execution per ticket basis.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like to be able to check all Automation rules executed against a given ticket on a single Audit Log page

fields.description:
h5. Problem
The dedicated error message configured for JMWE validators are not showing on the Portal's request form.

h5. Steps to reproduce the issue
# With a compatible version of the [Jira Misc Workflow Extensions|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/292/jira-misc-workflow-extensions?hosting=server&tab=overview] add-on installed, add a validator and specify a unique error message to be displayed if the input is not provided for the transition. Example configuration:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Raise the request via Portal without providing the required input and observe the error.
# Raise the request via Jira without providing the required input and observe the error.

h5. Expected Result
The dedicated error message is displayed correctly on the Portal's request form just like how it is on the Jira's Create Issue screen, telling users what is expected or which requirements are not fulfilled.

h5. Actual Result
* On the Portal, only the generic error message is displayed while the dedicated error message is missing.
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
* On the Jira's Create Issue screen, the dedicated error message is showing correctly.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h5. Notes
This is not affecting all validators of other add-ons. Tested the same with Suite Utilities for Jira's _Date Expression Compare_ validator and the error message is showing as expected.

(i) Related Bug ticket: [JSDSERVER-5882 Misleading validator's error message appears for requests failed to be created|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-5882] for the wrong error message displayed when a request cannot be raised due to permission error.
fields.summary: Validator's error message is not showing on the Raise a Request screen in the Customer Portal

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to update a Service Desk Report Series when username used in the series filter changed

This applies to any filter (other than username) that no longer valid.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new custom report in JIRA Service Desk.
 # Add a few series as below:
** *+Series 1+*
Set *filter by*:
{code:java}
assignee in ("testjira1@localhost.com" ,testjira2,testjira3)
{code}
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
 ** *+Series 2+*
Set *filter by*:
{code:java}
assignee in ("testjira1@localhost.com" ,testjira2)
{code}
!screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
# Save the report.
# Make some change to username and email for user [testjira1@localhost.com|mailto:testjira1@localhost.com]
 !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 
(i) In this example, I change the username and email from *testjira1@localhost.com* to *testjira13@localhost.com*
# Go back to the report and Click *Edit*.
# Edit the *Series 1* to include *testjira13@localhost.com* and get the error below:
 !screenshot-5.png|thumbnail! 
# From my observation, Jira is trying to save the series but unable to do so since *Series 2* since using Filter by *testjira1@localhost.com*
 !screenshot-6.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The user should be able to edit the series report after making changes in Username and Email.

h3. Actual Results
User unable to edit the series and below error is thrown
 !screenshot-7.png|thumbnail! 

A similar error pops up on the Browser Console:
{code}
PUT https://instance.atlassian.net/rest/servicedesk/reports/1/servicedesk/PTN/report/42/validate?timescaleId=2 400 ()
{code}

h3. Workaround
# Rename back the username and email back to the original.
# Remove the username from Filter by in each series that is used on.
# Changed the username and email.
# Add back the user in each series.

h3. Notes
- This can also affect series filtering for Request Types in the JQL. Jira will throw an error like so if the Request Type had been renamed:
{code}
There are no customer request types that match <affected request type>. Use the JQL auto suggestions to find the customer request type you're looking for.
{code}
fields.summary: Unable to update a Service Desk Report Series when username used in the series filter changed

h3. Summary
Adding Browse Project permission to any logged on users blocks the Non-customer comments feature in Jira Service Desk.  This feature was introduced in Jira [Service Desk 3.5.0|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk/jira-service-desk-3-5-x-release-notes-894738991.html].

h3. Environment
* Jira Service Desk 3.5.0 onwards

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a SD project, where any user can create and share issues.
# Set up incoming email
# Edit the notification scheme to add “Application Access - Any logged in user” to browse projects.
# Send an email from one email account
# Copy the issue key and place it in the subject of an email sent from a second different email account

h3. Expected Results
A comment is added to the issue

h3. Actual Results
This will create a new issue instead of adding a comment as expected.

h3.Workaround
Remove the user: “Application Access - Any logged in user” from browse projects permission.
fields.summary: Browse Project permission causes email comments to create new issues

fields.description:
h5. Problem
It's not possible to create linked issue using the Create Linked Issue function from a Service Desk project to another if the user is not an Agent of both projects.

h5. Steps to reproduce the issue
# Create a user with application access to Service Desk.
# Create 2 Service Desk projects which share the same permission scheme.
# Grant the user with the Service Desk Agent permission of one of the projects (project A). In the other project (project B), grant only Browse Projects, Create Issues and Link Issues permissions to the user.
#* This means that the user is an Agent of project A but not an Agent in project B.
# As an Agent of the Service Desk project, use the *Create Linked Issue* option to create a linked issue in the other Service Desk project (project B) which the user is not an Agent.

h5. Expected result
The Create Linked Issue operation can be completed without any error on the screen i.e. the issue is created and linked on the fly.

h5. Actual result
# On the Create Linked Issue screen, an error {{You do not have permission to link issues in this project}} appears and the operation cannot be completed.
# Even though with the Create Issues and Link Issues permissions in the targeted project, the Agent will not be able to create the linked issue. However, the create issue and link issue operations can be performed separately.
fields.summary: It's not possible to create linked issue from an SD project to another without Agent access on both projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When creating canned responses, there are times when information in a custom field should be provided to a customer.  The current list of variables available to use in the canned responses functionality is limited to a small number of available fields (7).  

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Agents to add custom field values by variable in the canned responses functionality.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently,

Users must be manually added or removed from an Organization in Jira Service Desk. 

This is a separate action from creating a user,  or adding a user to a group.

 

Today we use ldap groups to control access to Project access.

   Example.

      Groups =   Project-1-Agents,   Project-2-Agents,   Project-1-PortalUsers

      In Project Settings/Users & Roles:

          For Project 1 we have  Project-1-Agents in the Service Desk Team Role for Project 1,  and  Project-1-PortalUsers in the Service Desk Customer role

        For Project 2 we have Project-2-Agents in the Service Desk Team role

      Finally in Project Setting/Permissions  we give the Service Desk Team role all the permission we want an Agent to have. 

 

The net effect of the above approach is when we create and ID and put that ID in the appropriate groups they automatically get access to the JSD Projects they need.    However,  any Portal Users in Project-1-PortalUsers that need to be in an organization have be manually added to the organization.

 

The suggestion is to someone enable Organization membership to be tied a group.

If we had an Organizations in Project 1,  called  PortalUser-USA,  PortalUser-Europe  we'd like to be able to have a group named  PortalUser-USA,  PortalUser-Europe,  and have  the organization memmbership automatically match the group membership.
fields.summary: Allow Organization membership to be associated with a Group

fields.description:
h5. Problem
While searching for Request Types with a search term in the Customer Portal, the result contains request types of requests with the search term in the description.

h5. Steps to reproduce the issue
# Create 4 request types below.
||Request type name||Request type description||
| RT1 | Windows |
| RT2 | NA |
| NA | NA |
| Windows RT4 | NA |
# Create a request with request type "NA" with details below.
#* Summary: "Test"
#* Description: "Windows"
# Create another request with request type "RT2" with details below.
#* Summary: "Windows"
#* Description: "no description"
# In the Customer Portal, search with the word "Windows".

h5. Expected result
Search result returns RT1 and RT2 as the request type name/request type description/request summary contains the search term. 

h5. Actual result
Search result returns all 4 request types as there's one request with the search term in the request description.

h5. Notes
This is how the searching of Request Types work in a Customer Portal.
* Maximum 5 results return with the criteria below.
** Exact keyword match on either a Request Type name, Request Type description and summary.
** Most popular Request Types for the search terms that were typed in e.g. Request Type A has many requests created with the search terms in the summary, Request Type A will most likely appear in the search result.
fields.summary: Irrelevant request types in the Portal search result list

h5. Problem
It's not possible to add a user with Service Desk application access to a project's Customers list.

h5. Steps to reproduce the issue
# Create a Service Desk project with customer permissions to allow everyone with a Jira account to create requests.
# Create 2 users (A & B) with application access to Service Desk.
# Add user A to the project's Service Desk Team so that user A is an Agent of the project.
# On the Customers page, try adding user A and B to the Customers list.
# Create an Organization and add user A and B to the Organization.

h5. Expected results
* User B is added to the Customers list while User A is not because User A is an Agent of the project.

h5. Actual results
* It's not possible to add both user A and B to the Customers list, but it's possible to add them to an Organization.

h5. Notes (Our expectations)
User A is an Agent of the project, it'd make sense that Agent does not appear in the Customers list but User B is not an Agent of the project, which makes this user a potential customer. It should be possible to have User B in the Customers list without even adding the user manually.
fields.summary: It's not possible to add a user with Service Desk application access (but not a project Agent) to the Customers list

h3. Problem
In most organization, the users have a personal and company email addresses. As a customer, it is only their company email address that is registered as a customer. In some cases, they reply to the email notification thread (they have a mechanism to forward the email notification from company to the personal email address) using their personal email address. The comment is indeed received on the SD mailbox but failed to be added as a comment. It is not an option for the customer to set the Customer Permission to *Anyone can email the SD and raise a request in the portal* as it allows anyone to create a ticket. They only want to allow adding a comment and not raising a new request. 

h3. Suggestion
- It will be great if we can have the option to allow adding multiple email addresses linked to a single customer so that they can reply to the request using either email address and be able to add a comment on the request. 
- Allow an unregistered email address to be able to add a comment to an existing SD request.

h3. Summary
When creating issues and moving to the approval transition, duplicate approvals and created and as a result the approvers cannot approve a ticket.

h3. Environment
Jira Service Desk 3.12
Multiple automation rules 

h3. Expected Results
A single approval is created. Approvers can click the approve button to approve issues.

h3. Actual Results
Duplicate Approvals are shown in the Approval section of the ticket. Approvers cannot see the approval button.

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
More than one active approval found for issue[issue key:xxxx] and approver[user key:xxxx] combination 
{code}
 
h3. Notes
This may only be applicable if multiple automation rules are fired in quick succession.

h3.Workaround
Clone the issue, this will create a new issue with a single approval. 

Alternatively, downgrade to a version of Jira Service Desk prior to 3.12

h3. *Problem Definition*
Currently, when we moved a service desk issue to a JIRA core/software project the moved works perfectly fine. However when the user tries to access the issue via customer portal a warning message stating *This request has been moved to a project you don't have permission to view*
 !Current Warning Message.JPG|thumbnail! 
The user who is viewing the issue has permission both in JIRA service desk and the mentioned JIRA core.

h3. *Suggested Solution*
# Keep this warning message for normal JIRA service desk customer who only has customer level access to an instance.
# For users who have permission to create an issue in both service desk and the JIRA core/software project provides a more meaningful message such as:
#* This request has been moved to a nonservice desk project and display the URL to the moved issue so that the user can directly access it.
#* Or redirect the user to the moved location so that they can view the issue.

h3. *Why this is important*
This will provide a better visibility of the warning message to the end user as a customer can represent both external and internal whereby internal customer have access to both projects. A clear direction for a user who has access to the project where the issue was moved will reduce a great amount of friction and misunderstanding at users end.
fields.summary: Provide more meaningful Warning Message When Viewing Non-Service Desk Issue Via Customer Portal

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 6-Dec-2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hello, everyone! After comparing this bug request against the known bug report [JSDSERVER\-5786: Service Desk customer sign up/password reset page does not indicate if the password does not meet the password policy requirements|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-5786] we realized that both are addressing the same error with a slightly different scenario which is during account creation. We will be closing this request now and will ask you to cast your votes and add any additional feedback so we can have the impact of this issue gathered in one single request.

Best regards,
Amirul
{panel}

h3. Summary

Service Desk customer sign up page does not indicate why account cannot be created

h3. Environment
 * Jira Service Desk 3.12.1
 * Jira is using a read-only LDAP directory in the top ordered position
 * Jira Service Desk does have public sign up enabled, both for the system and for this project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As a new JSD customer, go to the login page http://localhost:8791/servicedesk/customer/portal/1/user/login?destination=portal%2F1
# click the "Sign up for an Account" link  http://localhost:8791/servicedesk/customer/portal/1/user/signup
# Enter in email address, password, and full name, then click 'Sign Up'


h3. Expected Results (end user)
Account should be created
OR
A clear error message needs to be displayed to the end user to explain why account was not created.


h3. Actual Results (end user)
* Nothing happens on the page
* User is not able to create an account
* only by looking into the browser's console when trying to click the signup button, is there an error generated such as:  {code:borderStyle=solid}
{"errors":[],"reasonKey":"Signup is not currently available","reasonCode":"400"} 
{code}



h3. Notes
We need to be more communicative with the end user to explain why they cannot create an account right now.   If this is a JSD specific setting preventing this, then the error message displayed on the screen should say so.   If it is a problem that stems from the Jira server settings like in this case, then the error message displayed should convey this detail.

h3. Workaround

The Jira administrator will have to
* Change the order of the user directories so that the read-only directory is not in the top/first position
fields.summary: Service Desk customer sign up page does not indicate why account cannot be created

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Service Desk customer sign up/password reset page does not indicate if the password does not meet the password policy requirements
h3. Environment
 * Jira Service Desk 3.12.1
 * Jira Server has enabled some password policy per /secure/admin/EditPasswordPolicy.jspa

h3. Steps to Reproduce (Sign up)
 # As a Jira administrator, enable any password policy on /secure/admin/EditPasswordPolicy.jspa (default is disabled, for the sake of this test, let's try to use 'Secure' option which
 #* Requires passwords to be at least 10 characters long and use at least 3 character types including at least 1 special character.
 #* Rejects passwords that are even slightly similar to the previous password or the user's public information.
 # As a JSD project administrator, go to the project administration page
 # From the left sidebar, choose customers
 # Then click the Add customers button in the top right corner
 # Enter a new customer's email address to invite them to the JSD project
 # As the customer at the other end of that email address, click the link in the email to go to Jira to setup your account
 # Enter in a password that does not meet the password policy in place for Jira, example password used ABCdef123456 (long enough, uses 3 character types, but has no special characters)

h3. Steps to Reproduce (Password Reset)
 # As a Jira administrator, enable any password policy on /secure/admin/EditPasswordPolicy.jspa (default is disabled, for the sake of this test, let's try to use 'Secure' option which
 ** Requires passwords to be at least 3 characters long and use at least 3 character types including at least 1 special character.
 ** Rejects passwords that are even slightly similar to the previous password or the user's public information.
 # As a JSD project administrator, go to the project administration page
 # From the left sidebar, choose customers
 # Then click the Add customers button in the top right corner
 # Enter a new customer's email address to invite them to the JSD project
 # As the customer at the other end of that email address, click the link in the email to go to Jira to setup your account
 # Enter in a password that does not meet the password policy in place for Jira, example - previous password

h3. Expected Results

This page in Jira should tell the end user that their password does not meet the password policy currently in place for this Jira site. AND The page should indicate which specific element of the password policy was not met. (In this case the lack of a special character)
h3. Actual Results
 * Nothing happens on the page.
 * The end user is not able to continue.
 * No visible error or warning appears in the browser
 * Only when looking at the browser console log can you see a HTTP 400 error (bad request) when trying to continue. Upon inspection of a HAR file of this even can we see a json response of
{code:java}
{"errors":[],"reasonKey":"The password must satisfy the password policy","reasonCode":"400"} 
{code}
However this response does not have any way currently to appear to the end user.

h3. Notes

!passwordsetuppage.png|width=238,height=153,thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

The Jira administrator either has to
 * Convey the password requirements ahead of time to the new user OR
 * temporarily disable the password policy

Another scenario from [JSDSERVER\-5791: Service Desk customer sign up page does not indicate why account cannot be created|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-5791] is during account creation. It gives a different error but it seems to be the same root cause.
fields.summary: Service Desk customer sign up/password reset page does not indicate if the password does not meet the password policy requirements

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Delete required custom field used for Customer portal will return an error when editing fields in the Request type
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new custom field.
# Add the Custom field in the Request type field. (Project Settings > Request types > Edit fields > Add field > Select (Custom field).
# Set the custom field to be *Required*.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Go to Custom field and delete the custom field
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
# Go back to Request type settings > Edit fields will return error *"Cannot Delete a field that is required by Jira or Jira Service Desk"*
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Jira warns the user that the custom field is used by Customer portal and cannot be deleted. If the user deletes the custom field required by Customer portal, the field in Edit field should be shown properly without error.

h3. Actual Results
No warning when user deleted required custom field used by Customer portal. If we edit the request type that associated with deleted custom field error below will appear.
!screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
The current workaround is to edit the *"AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFIELD"* in the database and set the Required value to false.

# Run below SQL to list out the Request types in the Service Desk
{code}
SELECT * from "AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFORM";
{code}
(i) Take note of the ID of the affected request types
# Run below SQL to list all the field in the request type affected.
{code}
SELECT * FROM "AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFIELD" where "FORM_ID" = <ID from Previous query>;
{code}
# Update the deleted customfield value and set the required value to *'f'*
{code}
UPDATE "AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFIELD" SET "REQUIRED" = 'f' where "FIELD_ID" = 'customfield_11301';
{code}
(i) Please change the "FIELD_ID" to follow your customfield name, in this case the customfield affected is customfield_11301
# Restart JIRA.
fields.summary: Unable to edit Request Type field configuration after previously deleting a required custom field

fields.description:
h3. Summary
This behavior was noticed when using [Issue Picker for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/de.catworkx.jira.plugins.cwx-issue-picker/server/overview] whereby the added field can be edited when using Edit button but cannot be edited using inline edit.

h3. Environment
* JSD 3.12.0
* [Issue Picker for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/de.catworkx.jira.plugins.cwx-issue-picker/server/overview]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install [Issue Picker for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/de.catworkx.jira.plugins.cwx-issue-picker/server/overview] plugin
# Create and configure an Issue Picker custom field as a single select. We can use JQL resolution is empty to get all issue or any other JQL as long as it displays a list of issues.
# Add the field to JSD screen.
# Visit one of the issues via view issue page in JIRA.
# Now try to use inline edit.

h3. Expected Results
The field can be edited as the option to select the list in the field is available in the drop down.

h3. Actual Results
Once we click inline edit and choose a new value the details are not saved
 
h3. Notes
The developer for the plugin have tested the behavior and shared with us on their insight.

# Current design code in service desk seems like disabling the inline edit as shown below{code}
JIRA.bind(JIRA.Events.INLINE_EDIT_BLURRED, function() { AJS.log('blurred...'); console.trace(); });
{code}
# As soon as you try to open the select box in inline edit mode, the event is fired and inline edit mode is cancelled.
The stacktrace shows that the minified JS of Jira Service Desk is what fires the event. The offending module is:
/* module-key = 'com.atlassian.servicedesk.frontend-webpack-plugin:context-jira.view.issue', location = 'jira.view.issue.bundle.js' */

h3. *Possible Solution*
Make sure only select2 fields with certain data- fields or CSS classes are used, so that JSD doesn't cancel editing for other fields. (courtesy of the plugin vendor)

h3.Workaround
Currently, to edit the value of the field instead of using inline edit, users can use the edit button available in view issue page.
fields.summary: JSD Javascript disbale Inline Edit for Select 2 field

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Sporadically, some users are unable to view Service Desk queues on one of the nodes for selected project. When user A is affected on Node 1, the user can see the queues on Node 2 and Node 3. Other users are also able to see the queues on Node 1 without any issue.

User A may at some point can view the SD queue on Node 1 of the same project. However, at some point, User B may then not able to view the SD queue on Node 2 (but possible on Node 1 and Node 3) for another project.

h3. Environment
* Jira Data Center
* {{useCachedQueueCount}} is enabled globally or selected projects

h3. Steps to Reproduce
(i) Theoritically would be
# Setup JDC with Service Desk installed
# Set {{useCachedQueueCount}} to true
{code:borderStyle=dashed}
PUT <contextpath>/rest/servicedeskapi/admin/queues/cache-count
{code}
# Access the SD queue

h3. Expected Results
* All nodes and all users able to see the correct results of the Service Desk queue

h3. Actual Results
* Some users and/or some nodes will see an empty Service Desk queue.
* The below exception is thrown in the {{atlassian-jira.log}} file:
{code}
2018-04-04 10:00:31,857 http-nio-8081-exec-19 url:/issues/rest/servicedesk/....ungrouped username:ABCDE  ERROR ABCDE 600x203691x18 57tuo5 172.26.0.80 /rest/servicedesk/1/PROJECT/webfragments/sections/sd-queues-nav,servicedesk.agent.queues,servicedesk.agent.queues.ungrouped [c.a.plugin.web.DefaultWebInterfaceManager] WebItemProvider from module 'com.atlassian.servicedesk.project-ui:sd-queues-custom-provider' threw an error 'io.atlassian.fugue.Pair cannot be cast to io.atlassian.fugue.Pair'.  Web-items provided by this provider will be ignored.
{code}
 
h3. Notes
How to check status of {{queueCount}}:
{code:borderStyle=dashed}
GET <contextpath>/rest/servicedeskapi/admin/queues/<projectkey>
{code}

Default settings:
{code:borderStyle=dashed}
"queueCount":{  
      "includeQueueCount":true,
      "useCachedQueueCount":false
   }
{code}


h3.Workaround
* Set {{useCachedQueueCount}} to false
** If performance is impacted when no cache used, set {{includeQueueCount}} to false
fields.summary: Service Desk Queues not visible for some users on some nodes

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary
* Automation Log shows a different username than the one executing the automation rules

h5. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a user as the default to execute Automation rules.
# Change the user's username from Jira Administration > User Management (this can be before or after step 1, it is not relevant).
# Trigger any automation rule.

h5. Expected Behavior
* The user shown in the automation log is the one indicated as Default.

h5. Actual Behavior
* The user indicated in the automation log is different than the indicated as Default.

h5. Cause
* It seems the automation log is using the original username instead of the current username, like the rest of the functionalities in Jira.

h5. Notes
* You can identify if this is your case by using the following query to get the original username of a user: {code}select distinct au.user_key original_username, au.lower_user_name current_username
from cwd_user u
left join app_user au  on u.lower_user_name = au.lower_user_name
where u.lower_user_name = 'current_username_here'{code}
** Replace _current_username_here_ with the current username.
* The information shown in the is the user Full name, the infor shown in the log is the user's original username, and the current username is not shown anywhere. See example:
**  Automation configuration: !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
** The Automation log:  !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
** User profile: !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Automation Log shows a different username than the one executing the automation rules

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have service Desk with either public sign up or any users that exist in JIRA
# Give a group jira administrator global permissions but not application access
# Assign an existing user that group

h3. Expected Results
The customer will be able to view the  Service Desk Portal

h3. Actual Results
The customer no longer has access to the Service Desk Portal.

Also, the following symptoms are observed:
- When accessing the mail Help Center link, the following error is shown in the UI:
{code}
It looks like you don't have access to this help center. If possible, please try contacting us another way.
{code}
 !Screen Shot 2019-07-23 at 11.43.23 AM.png|thumbnail! 
- When sending an email to the Service Desk Mail Handler to create an issue, the following error is found in the Mail logs:
{code}
You don't have permission to access this Service Desk.
{code}
 !Screen Shot 2019-07-23 at 12.03.11 PM.png|thumbnail! 
- If the user has not logged yet into Jira and tries to log into the Customer Portal, the login will fail with the following error:
{code}
You do not have a permission to log in. If you think this is incorrect, please contact your Jira administrators.
{code} 
 !AdminUserCantLogIn.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
This is especially susceptible when bringing in groups with LDAP and for the most part want the group to have admin access but some may not have application access.

h3.Workaround
- Remove the user from the group
- Give the customer application access

Currently when we closed an closed request which already has customer satisfaction filled out, the details of the customer satisfaction is cloned as well.

h3. *Steps to Reproduce*

# Create a request via a customer portal, resolved and close this request

h3. *Notes*

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior.

The saved report for AIO plugin is displayed.

fields.description:
Hello,

We have configured a custom Help Center in Confluence in order to better serve our employees' specific needs, and as such have a redirect set up from /servicedesk/customer/portals to that page.

However, if an employee clicks the "Help Center" button in the upper left of any /servicedesk/customer/ page, the redirect does not work. We checked that, and it looks like the javascript on the client browser makes a REST API call, and then it updates (not reloads) the page with new HTML to display the service center requests. So since the request never actually hits /servicedesk/customer/portals, we can't redirect them.

We'd like to see that changed so the URL is hit, or alternatively we'd like the ability to update the target URL for the Help Center within the JIRA Service Desk settings themselves. Thank you!
fields.summary: Change Help Center to hit /portals URL

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a customer tries to share a request with another customer who doesn't have access to the custoer portal, an error message pops up too quickly, so it is impossible for the customer to know why they can't share the request.

h3. Steps to reproduce
 - Create a Service Desk project
 - Go to Project Settings > Customer Permissions
 - Set "Who can raise requests?" to "Customers who have an account on this JIRA site"
 - Set "Who can customers share requests with?" to "Any customer, by typing an email address"
 - Go to the project's customer list page and create a customer account (called Customer1)
 - Log into the Customer portal as Customer1
 - Create a request
 - Try to share a request with an email address which is not part of the Project Customer list (called Customer2)

h3. Observed Results

An error message pops up and disappears too quickly to be able to read it, and Customer2 is not added to the request.
Here is a video showing this behavior:
 [^2018-04-04_1146.swf] 

If I slow down the video, I can pause it and see the actual error message:
{code}
 "Sorry, but the following usernames could not be added as participant to this request: share.servicedesk@gmail.com"
{code}
 !ErrorMessage.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The error message should not disappear, so that Customer1 can read it and know that they are not allowed to add Customer2.
fields.summary: When a customer tries to share a request with another customer who doesn't have access to the portal, an error message pops up too quickly

fields.description:
Currently in Service Desk if you use the Create button or 'c' key to create an issue it doesn't correctly create in Service Desk project.

The request type is not set, and notifications will not correctly be processed by Service Desk.

 

Workarounds:
* Set an automation rule so when an issue is created, the automation will set a Request type according to the Issue type:  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
** You might need to add several "IF" clauses to evaluate the different issue types on the project and set the relevant request type. 
* Do not use the "Create" button for Service Desk projects (or even restrict the issue creation Permission to agents in that project), use the "Raise request" option:  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
* You can add the Customer Request Type field to the Issue creation screen (although currently it is not possible to set the field as Required): !image-2018-05-08-15-39-02-633.png|thumbnail!
